About Me

I am a graduate student pursuing my Masters in Computer Science at the University of Florida seeking Internship opportunities as an Entry Level Software Engineer. I have previously worked in Hexagon as Software Developer where we developed 3D/2D designing software using C#, C++ & Node js. I also have experience building Full Stack Applications using React js, Javascript and various other frameworks.

Human Face Image Generation from Textual Descriptions

This is an unconventional project where we try to convert a given set of textual descriptions of a person into an actual images using GANs.Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) use a deep learning approach where two neural networks (Generator and Discriminator) compete with each other to become more accurate in their predictions.

Python tensorflow Pytorch Keras

Listify

Listify is a chrome extension which acts as your personal task manager.You can use it to remember some simple things such as "Drink water" or "Send an email to a friend".Listify enables you to write down all your tasks at one place and organise them.It makes you self aware and boosts your productivity.

Javascript Jquery Bootstrap CSS

Mercury

Mercury is Web-crawling bot which sends daily notifications to the students regarding college news,attendance to the students who have registered through the Mercury website. The bot services can be used by registering through the mercury website which is specially designed for the mobile devices.

Python Selenium Flask Pyrebase

Early Detection of Sepsis

  • Developed a website to create awareness for a life‑threatening disease called sepsis. Provided user functionalities where the user can Register, Login, and give his clinical data for early diagnosis of sepsis
  • Implemented a machine learning model to detect sepsis in patients using their clinical data. The model was developed using python, Scikit‑learn, Keras and an accuracy of 96% with Random‑forest mode
  • The website was built using Django, Bootstrap and the REST api for sepsis detection was developed using Flask,POSTGRESQL
Python Django Javascript Keras Scikit‑learn

Distinguishing Hate Speech from Sarcasm

21st century has seen a great deal of technological advancements, especially in mobile and cloud based technologies. This has caused a surge in social media usage and people have become more expressive than ever before on platforms such as facebook,twitter etc. However, this has caused horrific increase hate prevailing in internet. It has become quite a problem to distinguish and label the negative pieces in order to control them and make internet a safer place.An efficient dataset is a necessity for the model to classify hate speech and sarcasm in a go. We constructed a dataset by combining four different datasets. The constructed dataset is then balanced so that there is no bias when classifying the sentences. This dataset is evaluated on all the models described and a detailed comparison is done to find the best model for this task. We chose Bag of Words, BERT, TF-IDF and ERNIE models for the dataset evaluation.
IEEE ICONAT(2022): Distinguishing Hate Speech from Sarcasm

Pandas Scikit‑learn Keras

Zerocks

Zerocks is an application specific software built using Java Swing where we solve a trivial problem of students waiting in a queue to get their print-outs or xerox in the colleges. The software automates the process of getting a print-out and paying the shopkeeper in the college.

Java Java Swing Java Sockets
